page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: {The County Primary School}serves the village of Over and comprises two separate buildings, an old block built in 1852 and a new section completed in 1980. There are 240 children on roll, nine full-time and one part-time teachers and three assistants.Children are grouped into 4 infant and 4 junior classes, admitting them in the year they are 5.Most children attend the local Village College(a secondary comprehensive) at Swavesey at eleven plus. The school day lasts from 9am. to 3.15 pm. with a morning break for all, an afternoon break for infants and lunch from 12 to 1.15 pm.A cooked meal, operated on a credit cafeteria system, is taken by 44 children, 115 bring a packed lunch and 81 go home to dinner.
